Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Transversus Thoracic Muscle Plane Block in Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a randomised controlled trial at a single institution

Participants.evidence: adults aged 18-50 years, ASA physical status II-III, scheduled for elective cardiac surgery with median sternotomy

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either a pre-induction TTPB with 30 mL of 0.2% ropivacaine or no block

Objective.evidence: This study investigated the impact of a pre-induction transversus thoracic muscle plane block (TTPB) on intraoperative haemodynamic response and perioperative fentanyl requirement in adult cardiac surgery patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraoperative haemodynamic response, assessed by changes in MAP and HR.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fifteen patients were randomised, with 7 receiving TTPB and 8 in the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Fifteen patients were randomised, with 7 receiving TTPB and 8 in the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean intraoperative fentanyl consumption was lower in the TTPB group (7.93 ± 1.16 µg kg−1).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to the block were reported.
